trans-unit.target: TEXT_HEAVNZ204_01773_SEQ_00<tab>Guenaret needs help calming a distressed chocobo.
TEXT_HEAVNZ204_01773_SEQ_01<tab>The chocobo just taken by Guenaret has been crying out incessantly, and he asks that you return to the site of the capture─specifically to look out for a chocobo nest.
TEXT_HEAVNZ204_01773_SEQ_02<tab>Upon investigating the site, you find several chocobo eggs lying in an undisturbed nest. Return to Guenaret and report your findings.

TEXT_HEAVNZ204_01773_SEQ_03<tab>After returning to Guenaret, he informs you that a rule among hunters forbids the capture of chocobos that are nursing eggs. The future mother will be released back to her nest, ensuring the chocobo population remains stable.

TEXT_HEAVNZ204_01773_GUENARET_000_010<tab>By the Twelve, this chocobo just won't shut up. She's got no hurts as far as I can see, and a sick bird wouldn't make such a fuss. Which leaves just one possibility.

TEXT_HEAVNZ204_01773_GUENARET_000_011<tab>I've a mind to go and verify my suspicion, but I'm not overly keen on leaving this bird while it's wailing away like this─could attract predators. Would you mind going?

TEXT_HEAVNZ204_01773_GUENARET_000_012<tab>Here, lend me your map─I'll mark the place we caught this bird. Chances are there's a nest nearby. If you find it, note what's inside and come back to tell me.
TEXT_HEAVNZ204_01773_GUENARET_000_020<tab>We caught that chocobo at the place I marked on your map. I need you to look for a nest nearby and see what's in it.
TEXT_HEAVNZ204_01773_GUENARET_000_050<tab>Just as I thought, this one's 'bout to be a mother. There's no helping it, then. As fine a bird as she is, she's gotta go back to her nest.

TEXT_HEAVNZ204_01773_GUENARET_000_051<tab>It's a rule of ours, you see: you can't catch a chocobo what's brooding. Don't matter that it's the finest specimen you've ever seen, or that you've been having a bad spell.
TEXT_HEAVNZ204_01773_GUENARET_000_052<tab>Nay, whatever the circumstance, we've got to see beyond the present, elsewise we hunters won't have much of a future.
